dmca.title: Copyright violation on theplanet.com hosted site.
dmca.body:
_____  

From: James P Brown [mailto:brown@editorsforstudents.com] 
Sent: Monday, March 27, 2006 2:11 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Copyright violation on theplanet.com hosted site.



To: ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. and all subsidiaries

George Poletes, Corporate Counsel
1333 Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110, Dallas, TX 75207

Ph: (214) 782-7800

Fax: (214) 782-7756

copyright@theplanet.com


Dear Mr. Polentes,

I'm writing regarding a site hosted on The Planet that has significantly
plagiarized from various sites on the web, including my own, in violation of
the Digital Millennium Copyright Act. The specific site in question is
http://www.contentconcepts.net/. This copyright violation came to my
attention when I crosschecked my page
http://www.editorsforstudents.com/editing.html on http://www.copyscape.com. 

Text plagiarized from EditorsForStudents.com includes the following, at the
URL listed below:

At http://www.contentconcepts.net/ the following text was plagarized from
www.edtiorsforstudents.com/editing.html (text plagiarized from
EditorsForStudents.com is in bold)::


Grammar: Errors in grammar, correct subject-verb agreement, pronoun
referents, run-on and fragmented sentences, weak or improper verb usage, and
other fatal grammatical mistakes are checked.

Style & Voice: We work to give it a unique style and voice, eliminating
awkward or vague words and phrases and replacing them with elegant and
precise ones, ensuring that your writing is not only more consistent, but
also more professional.

In addition to plagiarizing specific text from EditorsForStudents.com,
contentconcepts.net has taken the basic editorial categories (the "services
offered" at EditorsForStudents.com) and placed them on their site, creating
a list of services that closely imitates Editors For Student's. For
instance, contentconcepts.net has plagiarized the category "Style & Voice"
down to the ampersand in this descriptive phrase.

Archive.org will show that the plagiarized copy originally appeared on my
page. In all likelihood, judging from my past experience, plagiarized copy
both from EditorsForStudents.com and other sites appears on other pages at
contentconcepts.net.

Contentconcepts.net's flagrant plagraisim creates the impression that copy
appearing on my site may itself have been plagiarized, and therefore
undermines the originality and veracity of editorsforstudents.com. As a
result, I'm forced to write to request, pursuant to the recommendations of
the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, that you take further action,
including, if necessary, removing Contentconcepts.net from it's current home
on the Internet until their site is revised to comply with copyright law.

Under the penalty of perjury, I attest that the information contained in
this email is true and correct and that contentconcepts.net has not been
authorized to use the text of EditorsForStudents.com. As the president of
EditorsForStudents.com, I am authorized to lodge this complaint against the
offending party.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,
James Brown, President
EditorsForStudents.com

45 North Market St. #306
Lancaster, PA 17603
Ph: 717-431-8932
Fax: 717-291-1485
brown@editorsforstudents.com
